alert.note: Alert for Luna (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 07 at 4:52PM MDT until August 07 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southern Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 449 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Columbus. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * Motorists along State Highway 11 should be aware of the strong cross winds and low visibilities associated with the blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Carzalia Valley, Hermanas, Sunshine, Rock Hound State Park, Camp Ramsey and Spring Canyon State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
